question: [File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_entrypoint_frame()] [Dummy local initialization] All parameters are initialized with dummy_local() - can this cause issues if the function expects specific initialization patterns? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_entrypoint_frame()] [UnmeteredGasMeter safety] The use of UnmeteredGasMeter assumes gas was already charged - can an attacker replay traces that never actually executed, bypassing gas costs? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Frame swap race] The std::mem::swap at line 650 swaps current_frame with the new frame - can concurrent access cause frame confusion in parallel execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Call stack overflow] If call_stack.push() fails with overflow error, the error message says 'cannot overflow during replay' - but can deep recursion in malicious code actually cause this? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Parameter type checking skip] When mask.is_captured(i) is true, no type check is performed - can this allow captured parameters with wrong types? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Reverse parameter iteration] Parameters are processed in reverse from (0..num_params).rev() - can this cause issues with calling conventions that expect forward order? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Local storage failure] If locals.store_loc fails for any parameter index, are previously stored locals cleaned up or do they remain in inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Type substitution overflow] When creating expected_ty with type substitution, can very large generic type arguments cause stack overflow or memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: set_new_frame()] [Empty ty_args bypass] When ty_args.is_empty(), the original expected_ty is used without substitution - can generic functions be called without type arguments? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function()] [Cache poisoning] Can an attacker manipulate the function_cache map to point idx to a different function than expected, causing type confusion? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function()] [Per-instruction cache bypass] If per_instruction_cache[pc] contains stale data from a previous execution, can it cause wrong function to be loaded? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function()] [Entry::Vacant race] Between checking Entry::Vacant and inserting the new function, can concurrent access insert a different function? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function()] [Frame cache sharing] Multiple call sites cache references to the same Rc<RefCell<FrameTypeCache>> - can one call site corrupt the cache affecting others? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function()] [Non-generic assumption] The function is cached as non-generic - can generic functions be incorrectly cached here causing type parameter loss? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/runtime_type_checks_async.rs] [Function: load_function_generic()] [PC out of bounds] If pc is manipulated to exceed per_instruction_cache bounds, can this cause memory unsafety? (Critical)
